text: The equirectangular projection (also called the geographic projection) is a simple map view made about 100 AD.Flattening the Earth: Two Thousand Years of Map Projections, John P. Snyder, 1993, pp. 5-8, . The projection maps Longitude and Latitude (vertical and horizontal map lines) to even straight lines. Because the map is stretched out, it can not be used in navigation.
